column4: Microsoft turned down facial-recognition sales on human rights concerns
column5: PALO ALTO Microsoft Corp recently rejected a California law enforcement agency’s request to install facial recognition technology in officers’ cars and body cameras due to human rights concerns  company President Brad Smith said on Tuesday.

column4: Qualcomm stock jumps 23 percent on surprise settlement with Apple
column5: Qualcomm Inc on Tuesday won a major victory in its wide-ranging legal dispute with Apple Inc as the companies reached a surprise settlement that called for the iPhone to once again use Qualcomm modem chips. | Video

column4: Fried chicken vs $13: Apple  Qualcomm explain claims to jury as trial opens
column5: SAN DIEGO  Calif. Apple Inc and Qualcomm Inc on Tuesday opened  a complex trial with the iPhone maker using a fried chicken analogy to illustrate its claim the chip company is abusing  its market power while Qualcomm alleged a years-long plan by Apple to deprive it of billions in revenue  $13 at a time.

column4: UPDATE 7-Qualcomm stock jumps 23 percent on surprise settlement with Apple
column5: April 16 Qualcomm Inc on Tuesday won a major victory in its wide-ranging legal dispute with Apple Inc as the companies reached a surprise settlement that called for the iPhone to once again use Qualcomm modem chips.
